comments: This number figures in our standard 12-tone tuning of music today.It represents the frequency ratio of a semitone in equal temperament. The equal-tempered chromatic scale divides the octave, which has a ratio of 2:1, into twelve parts of equal ratio: [2^(n/12), 2^((n+1)/12)), 0 <= n <= 11. - _Daniel Forgues_, Feb 28 2013
references: D. Coulter, Digital Audio Processing. Berkeley, California: Focal Press (2000) p. 30
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Index entries for sequences based on music
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
